title: 20-0008-UT Lift Station 16 Pierce St.
description: The project consists of demolishing the current lift station and constructing a new 4.9 MGD lift station located at the Western end of Pierce St.

title: Reclaimed Water Piping Improvement
description: Installation of 2”, 4”, 8”, 16” reclaimed water main pipe installation/replacements via various installation methods using HDPE, PVC, & Ductile Iron pipe materials; Replacement of 8” VCP gravity main with PVC; Replacement of various size RCW gate valves across various areas of the City service area; Replacement of reclaimed water service lines; Installation of associated fittings, connections etc.

title: PROFESSIONAL SERVICES-NEGOTIATIONS WITH MLB TEAM
description: The city of Clearwater, Florida, is seeking proposals from qualified firms to assist in the ongoing negotiations with a Major League Baseball (MLB) franchise. Qualified firms must be able to provide substantial evidence of successfully negotiating with MLB or other professional sports franchises on behalf of a municipal or county government.

title: CAYENTA TESTING & REPORT BUILDING SERVICES
description: The City of Clearwater is seeking a qualified vendor for software quality assurance testing and report building in a Cayenta Utility Management System (UMS) environment. The City is upgrading its Cayenta environment by migrating its database from Oracle to a Structured Query Language (SQL) Server, and its reporting system from Actuate to Cognos.

title: INVESTMENT ADVISORY SERVICES - 457 AND 401(a) RETIREMENT PLANS
description: The City is seeking experienced and qualified financial advisory firm(s) capable of demonstrating the highest level of ability to provide retirement plan investment advisory and consulting services.

title: SINGLE STREAM RECYCLING PROCESSING
description: The City of Clearwater is seeking a qualified Vendor to perform Recovered Material Processing Facility (RMPF) Services for the processing and marketing of Single Stream Recycling Program Materials (“Material”, “Program Materials”) on behalf of customers of the City’s Solid Waste Recycling Program, including its constituents and partner municipalities (collectively known as “Customers.”)

title: WELL MAINTENANCE, EVALUATION AND MIT SERVICES
description: The City of Clearwater is soliciting sealed bids from qualified contractors to establish a term contract for well maintenance, evaluation and mechanical integrity testing services for the Public Utilities’ Water Treatment Plant Production Wells and Class I Injection Well.
